title: Overview
text: SRDP produces seven different datasets that are connected.

title: Strategies of Resistence Data Project
text: Strategies of Resistance Data Project (SRDP) is a global dataset on organizational behavior in self-determination disputes. It is actor-focused and spans periods of relative peace and violence in self-determination conflicts. By linking tactics to specific actors in broader campaigns for political change, we can better understand how these struggles unfold over time, and the conditions under which organizations use conventional politics, violent tactics, nonviolent tactics, or some combination of these.

title: Demands
text:
This dataset describes each self-determination group’s specific SD-related demands made. It forms the backbone of the SRDP dataset: if an organization is not making SD demands, it is considered inactive. If an organization is inactive for three or more years, it exits the dataset. Because groups consist of organizations, a group’s existence is also defined from these demands.




Data provided to 2005.




Organization - year.




For related discussions or questions.

title: Groups
text:
This dataset provides all known SD groups, the country in which they predominantly operate, and their start and (if applicable) end years.




Data provided to 2020.




Group.




For related discussions or questions.

title: Groups
text:
Data collection
All groups and the countries in which they predominently operate were identified in K. Cunningham’s Inside the Politics of Self-Determination.
A group’s start date is set to the first identified as the highest of either:

The start date for any of its composite organizations; or,
The first year in the dataset: 1960.

A group’s end date is set to the last identified year in which one of their composite organizations was identified as active.

title: Organizations
text:
This dataset provides all known SD organizations, their parent group, and their start and (if applicable) end years.




Data provided to 2020.




Organization




For related discussions or questions.

title: Organizations
text:
Data collection
All organizations are identified through the SD demands coding process.
An organization’s start date is set to the first identified demand they made.
An organization’s end date is set to the year in which they explicitly broke up or ceased operating, or three years following their last identified SD demand.

title: Organization aliases
text:
This dataset provides all known aliases for each identified SD organizations. This dataset allows us to search for, and capture, all report or articles related to the organization.




Data provided to 2023.




Organization




For related discussions or questions.

title: Organization aliases
text:
Data collection
All organization aliases are identified through the SD demands coding process.

title: Concessions
text:
This dataset describes each concession made by the government being challenged to the self-determination group.




Data provided to 2020.




Group - year.




For related discussions or questions.

title: Concessions
text:
Data collection
Manual data collection process.

title: Tactics, non-violent
text:
This dataset describes each self-determination organization’s use of non-violent tactics in each year. Non-violent tactics identified are: economic non-cooperation; protests or demonstrations; non-violent intervention; social non-cooperation; and political non-cooperation. We also identify instances of institutional participation.




Data provided to 2020.




Organization - year.




For related discussions or questions.

title: Tactics, non-violent
text:
Data collection
Manual data collection process.

title: Tactics, violent
text:
This dataset describes the target of each self-determination organization’s use of violent tactics. The targets tracked are: the state; other SD organizations; in-group individuals; and out-group individuals. We also identify whether the organization targeted these groups fatally.




Data provided to 2020.




Organization - year.




For related discussions or questions.
